The Eminence in Shadow.title: The Eminence in Shadow
The Eminence in Shadow.description: Shadowbrokers are those who go unnoticed, posing as unremarkable people, when in truth, they control everything from behind the scenes. Sid wants to be someone just like that more than anything, and something as insignificant as boring reality isn’t going to get in his way! He trains in secret every single night, preparing for his eventual rise to power—only to denied his destiny by a run-of-the-mill (yet deadly) traffic accident. But when he wakes up in a another world and suddenly finds himself at the head of an actual secret organization doing battle with evil in the shadows, he’ll finally get a chance to act out all of his delusional fantasies!

e1.title: The Hated Classmate
e1.description: Akane copes with her trauma by being popular and working hard to make people like her, but one boy in her class doesn’t care about her at all. That bothers her to no end.

e2.title: Shadow Garden Is Born
e2.description: Reincarnated as the son of Baron Kagenou, Cid bides his time as Background Character A while preparing for the day he can finally become the Eminence in Shadow!

e3.title: Fencer Ordinaire
e3.description: The princess is supposed to reject the background character’s confession, not accept it — since when did Cid become a rom-com protagonist?

e4.title: Sadism's Rewards
e4.description: The mistake those with power always make is believing that they are the ones in control.

e5.title: I Am...
e5.description: Cid is not facing a minion but a would-be Knight of the Rounds. Normally, that is cause for concern, but an atomic bomb has no reason to fear the gnashing of a lowly pest.

e6.title: Pretenders
e6.description: While Iris seeks a bright mind to study an artifact, Cid visits a popular store. Meanwhile, in the dark corners of the city, someone commits murders in Shadow Garden’s name!

e7.title: A Fencing Tournament of Intrigue and Bloodshed
e7.description: Cid gets a report from Nu about powerful cult members lurking in the Royal Capital. Too bad he’s too distracted about the upcoming fencing tournament to notice.

e8.title: Dark Knight Academy Under Attack
e8.description: Cid sacrificed his life to save Rose. At least, that’s what everyone thinks. Unbeknownst to anyone else, Cid survived exactly as planned, and now his counterattack can begin.

e9.title: The End of a Lie
e9.description: When the students fight back, Shadow Garden joins the fray as their reinforcements. Amidst the chaos, Cid confronts the Gaunt Knight.

e10.title: The Sacred Land, City of Deception
e10.description: Cid heads to Lindwurm in response to a summons from Alpha, but he is not the only one traveling there; the annual Goddess’ Trial is quickly approaching.

e11.title: The Goddess' Trial
e11.description: The curtain rises on the Goddess’ Trial. When Cid is unwittingly called into the arena, he transforms into Shadow and faces none other than Aurora, the Witch of Calamity.

e12.title: The Truth Within the Memories
e12.description: The door to the Sanctuary opens and Alpha strides through it, intending to expose the Cult’s grave secrets. Meanwhile, Cid also enters the Sanctuary and reunites with… Aurora?

e13.title: A Bloody Showdown as an Offering to Annihilation
e13.description: Alpha faces off against an empowered Nelson in a vicious battle. Elsewhere, Cid and Aurora reach the Sanctuary's core, but a door only a hero can open blocks their path.

e14.title: Your Lie, Your Wish
e14.description: Cid’s victory is short-lived when Nelson counters with his new magic. Meanwhile, Alexia convinces Rose and Natsume to form an alliance to uncover the truth of their world.

e15.title: The Strongest Weakest Man
e15.description: Only the strongest warriors can advance in the prestigious Bushin Festival, but one contestant proves himself a feeble and mundane man with no talent. Why is he competing?

e16.title: Unseen Intentions
e16.description: Princess Rose flees to the north of the Royal Capital. The Oriana Kingdom wants to handle it internally as a 'purely domestic' matter.

e17.title: Moonlight That Pierces the Darkness
e17.description: Cid recollects piano lessons from his past life — what impact does this have on his present? Meanwhile, Epsilon’s performance sets the soundtrack for something else...

e18.title: Betting on a Moment
e18.description: Cid and Claire receive an invitation to a tournament. At the festivities, Cid receives more attention than a background character desires.

e19.title: Dancing Puppet
e19.description: Doem tries to make war with Midgar. Meanwhile, the match between Jimina and Iris begins.

e20.title: Advent of the Demon
e20.description: Provoked by the fight between Shadow and Beatrix, Iris joins the fray. An intense battle progresses across the Royal Capital. Meanwhile, Rose runs into Alpha.

e1.title: The Lawless City
e1.description: Cid and his sister Claire venture to the huge slum known as the “Lawless City.” There, Cid gets caught up in the commotion caused by the Red Moon.

e2.title: The Haven
e2.description: The moon is red. The frenzy has begun. Shadow is introduced to power players in Lawless City. Meanwhile, Mary and Claire run into Juggernaut.

e3.title: The Hour of Awakening
e3.description: The night the red moon rises, the Blood Queen Elisabeth makes her return.

e4.title: Mask of Falsehood
e4.description: The Mitsugoshi Company is doing great, all thanks to Gamma! However, the biggest crisis imaginable rears its ugly head.

e5.title: He Who Pulls the Strings
e5.description: Alpha and Gamma carefully plot not take any actions that would implicate Mitsugoshi's connection to Shadow Garden. Meanwhile, John Smith has a plot of his own.

e6.title: John Smith
e6.description: John Smith's skill is leagues above even the most skilled fighters! Who is this mysterious person?

e7.title: Something Precious
e7.description: The Major Corporate Alliance has forced closure of all their storefronts, bringing the citizens' unrest to its peak. But can Shadow Garden weather the storm?

e8.title: The Dragon’s Tears
e8.description: With Cid missing and things getting hot, the Shadow Garden springs into action. At the Mitsugoshi Hot Springs Land that is!

e9.title: The Key
e9.description: On the way to the Kingdom of Oriana, Cid is also on a journey of self-discovery and reflection. He feels like something's missing. Is he imagining it?

e10.title: Caged Bird
e10.description: Did Princess Rose Oriana take it upon herself to join up with the enemy? Not even the Seven Shadows have authority over this matter anymore.

e11.title: Determination
e11.description: With Princess Rose’s hands tied as Perv has taken her mother hostage, the Eminence in Shadow must move to free the captive himself.

e12.title: HIGHEST
e12.description: Let the banquet of slaughter begin in the season finale.

Toradora!.title: Toradora!
Toradora!.description: Ryūji Takasu is a gentle high school student with a love for housework; but in contrast to his kind nature, he has an intimidating face that often gets him labeled as a delinquent. On the other hand is Taiga Aisaka, a small, doll-like student who is anything but a cute and fragile girl. Equipped with a wooden katana and feisty personality, Taiga is known throughout the school as the 'Palmtop Tiger.' One day, an embarrassing mistake causes the two students to cross paths. Ryūji discovers that Taiga actually has a sweet side: she has a crush on the popular vice president, Yūsaku Kitamura, who happens to be his best friend. But things only get crazier when Ryūji reveals that he has a crush on Minori Kushieda—Taiga's best friend! Toradora! is a romantic comedy that follows this odd duo as they embark on a quest to help each other with their respective crushes, forming an unlikely alliance in the process.

e1.title: Tiger and Dragon
e1.description: On the first day of school, Ryūji discovers that he and Taiga, the meanest girl in class, share a secret: each loves the other's best friend.

e2.title: Taiga and Ryuji
e2.description: Taiga's efforts to get closer to Yūsaku fail: A scheme in basketball ends with Taiga knocked out, and she drops a plate of cookies out a window.

e3.title: Your Song
e3.description: Ryūji and Taiga spend a day helping Minori at one of her many part-time jobs, and Ryūji gets to know her better when they're locked in a storehouse.

e4.title: That Look You Had
e4.description: Taiga has a photo album full of blurry pictures of Kitamura. Ryūji offers to snap some pictures of him instead.

e5.title: Kawashima Ami
e5.description: Yūsaku's childhood friend Ami, a model, transfers to the school and immediately becomes popular with everyone but Taiga, who sees the truth about her.

e6.title: True Self
e6.description: Followed by a stalker, Ami hides out with Taiga and decides that she must discard her fake personality from now on.

e7.title: Pool's Open
e7.description: When the school's pool opens for the summer, the gang shops for new swimsuits, and Ryūji helps Taiga with an embarrassing problem.

e8.title: Who Is This For?
e8.description: Ryūji tries to help Taiga win a swimming race against Ami, but when Ryūji nearly drowns, the truth about Taiga's feelings comes out.

e9.title: When You Go To The Sea
e9.description: During a trip to Ami's beach villa, Taiga has a nightmare about being married to Ryūji and schemes to bring him and Minori together.

e10.title: Fireworks
e10.description: The gang plots an elaborate stunt to scare Minori with a trip to a nearby cave where Yūsaku has planted scary traps, but Yūsaku and Minori disappear.

e11.title: Ohashi High School Culture Festival 1
e11.description: As preparations get under way for the school's cultural festival, Ryūji urges Taiga to consider reconciling with her estranged father.

e12.title: Ohashi High School Culture Festival 2
e12.description: Taiga's reconciliation with her father divides her friends, but she ends up disappointed when her father doesn't attend her school play.

e13.title: Ohashi High School Culture Festival 3
e13.description: Taiga wins a beauty contest despite a crushing disappointment about her father; a race is held to determine who will dance with Taiga.

e14.title: Palm-top Tiger of Happiness
e14.description: A rumor starts that touching Taiga leads to good luck; Yūsaku gets some interesting news from the student council president.

e15.title: Distant Star
e15.description: Yūsaku has a meltdown in class, dyes his hair blond and refuses to run for student council, causing everyone to wonder what's wrong with him.

e16.title: One Step Forward
e16.description: Yūsaku reveals his love for Sumire, a student council president who is leaving to study abroad, so his friends urge him to run for her council seat.

e17.title: Mercury is Retrograde at Christmas
e17.description: With Christmas approaching, the student council plans a party while Taiga decides to curry favor with Santa by playing Cupid for Ryūji and Minori.

e18.title: Underneath the Fir Tree
e18.description: The entire class pitches in to assemble an artificial Christmas tree with a glass star, but a stray fly ball destroys the decorations.

e19.title: Christmas Eve Party
e19.description: The love triangle of Ryūji, Minori and Taiga reaches a crisis point when true feelings are realized during the school's Christmas Eve party.

e20.title: Stay Like This Forever
e20.description: The class trip to Okinawa is canceled, leading to a last-minute change of plans to a ski trip, where Ryūji resolves to tell Minori how he feels.

e21.title: Can't Help Myself
e21.description: During the ski trip, Ryūji confesses his feelings for Minori, but not to her. When Taiga disappears, everyone frantically searches for her.

e22.title: When You're Around
e22.description: Knowing that Taiga believes she was rescued by Yūsaku during the ski trip, Ryūji asks Yūsaku to pretend that she's correct.

e23.title: Path to Take
e23.description: When Yasuko collapses from anemia due to overwork, Ryūji and Taiga take over her job of selling chocolate and use Ami's celebrity to improve sales.

e24.title: Confession
e24.description: The truth about Taiga and Ryūji's feelings for each other finally comes out, and they make a plan to run off together and get married.

e25.title: Toradora!
e25.description: When Yasuko reconciles with her parents, the truth about Ryūji's father is revealed, inspiring him to have a traditional wedding with Taiga.

The Quintessential Quintuplets.title: The Quintessential Quintuplets
The Quintessential Quintuplets.description: Fuutarou Uesugi is a poor, antisocial ace student who one day meets the rich transfer student Itsuki Nakano. They argue but when Uesugi realizes he is to be her tutor, he tries to get on better terms. While trying to do so he meets four other girls.

e1.title: The Quintessential Quintuplets
e1.description: Uesugi Fuutarou lands a tutoring job that promises five times the normal pay. As it turns out, it’s going to take more than five times the work.

e2.title: Rooftop Confession
e2.description: Futaro proposes an exam to settle the debate of whether or not the quintuplets need a tutor.

e3.title: A Mountain of Problems
e3.description: Nino isn't happy that Futaro is beginning to get along with her sisters, so she takes matters into her own hands.

e4.title: A Day Off
e4.description: Futaro receives his first pay, and decides to take Raiha to the arcade, where she’s always wanted to go.

e5.title: Five Fifths
e5.description: The fireworks have started, but the girls are still split up. Ichika wanders off on her own, and Futaro goes after her.

e6.title: What's Been Built Up
e6.description: The midterm exams are coming up, and the girls' father set Futaro up to a seemingly impossible task.

e7.title: Liar McLieface
e7.description: Futaro spent the night at the quintuplets' apartment. He wakes up to an unexpected situation.

e8.title: The Photo That Started It All
e8.description: Futaro falls ill after Miku feeds him a hefty serving of croquettes. Nino makes the situation even worse than it needs to be.

e9.title: Legend of Fate Day 1
e9.description: School is abuzz about the camp school trip coming up. Meanwhile, Raiha catches the flu.

e10.title: Legend of Fate Day 2
e10.description: Futaro and the girls arrive at camp school. His outfit for the test of courage causes more than just a scare for Nino.

e11.title: Legend of Fate Day 3
e11.description: Ichika and Futaro get locked in the storage shed. The others are concerned about their absence, but not necessarily for the same reasons.

e12.title: Legend of Fate Day 2000
e12.description: It’s the last day of camp school. Itsuki is missing. Futaro thinks he knows where to find her, but he’s sick and shouldn’t be wandering in the snow.

e1.title: Quite the Crappy Kyoto Quagmire
e1.description: Futaro is hospitalized for a while after falling sick at camp school. He returns to work tutoring the quintuplets, only to realize someone has fallen way behind.

e2.title: Seven Goodbyes (1)
e2.description: There’s one week left to the term final. Futaro and the sisters are set on passing this time, but Nino and Miku can’t seem to get along.

e3.title: Seven Goodbyes (2)
e3.description: Nino lets a dejected Futaro into her hotel room. Futaro tells her about how he’d run into the girl he met in Kyoto five years prior.

e4.title: Seven Goodbyes (3)
e4.description: After discovering Yotsuba wants to quit the Track team but can't tell her teammates, Uesugi disguises Itsuki to resign for her.

e5.title: Good Work Today
e5.description: Uesugi runs into the Quintuplets while out shopping. They invite him to visit their new home with an ulterior motive.

e6.title: The Last Exam
e6.description: Miku is desperately trying to learn how to make chocolates for Uesugi. Meanwhile, preparations for the Final exams are intensifying, but Uesugi decides it's time for a study break.

e7.title: Begin the Offensive
e7.description: The quintuplet's father attempts to convince Nino to come back with him, but Uesugi rides in to save the day and Nino makes a confession. The quintuplets then celebrate their exam achievements with desserts. Later, everyone enjoys a vacation at a hot springs resort.

e8.title: Scrambled Eggs
e8.description: Uesugi enlists the 'real' Itsuki to help him discover who was impersonating her yesterday. After discovering a room full of Itsuki, he interrogates them one by one. Uesugi struggles to tell which quintuplet is which.

e9.title: Welcome to Class 3-1
e9.description: The quintuplets each find a job to help Ichika pay for the rent of their new place. They each settle into their new jobs and their new classmates.

e10.title: Five Cranes in Return
e10.description: The quintuplets’ father tries to get Futaro’s classmate, Takeda, to take over as their tutor. They make a bet.

e11.title: Sisters War (1)
e11.description: Ichika, Nino, and Itsuki plot ways to make a move on Futaro during the school trip. Yotsuba is troubled by their change in attitude.

e12.title: Sisters War (2)
e12.description: With desperation increasing, things become tense amongst the sisters as well as with Futaro. For their elective tour on the last day of the school trip, the quintuplets decide to keep things fair by leaving the outcome to luck.

The Asterisk War.title: The Asterisk War
The Asterisk War.description: Invertia was a meteor storm that caused an unprecedented disaster during the 20th century. Because of this disaster, numerous cities around the world were destroyed. However, within the meteor, an unknown element called mana was discovered. It allowed human technology to make rapid strides giving rise to a new species of super-powered humans, the Star Pulse Generation (Genestella). The Festas (Star Warrior Festivals) host battles between Genestella at a city of six academies called “Rikka,” also commonly known as “Asterisk.” Scholarship student Ayato Amagiri transferred into Seidoukan Academy in order to fulfill his own wish, swearing he too will fight in this city.

e1.title: Glühen Ros
e1.description: Ayato Amagiri is a scholarship transfer student. What awaits him at the Seidoukan Academy?

e2.title: Ser=Versta
e2.description: Since Julis is indebted to Ayato, she offers to show him around the academy. Little does she know that she is not the only one who wants to be Ayato's tour guide!

e3.title: A Holiday for Two
e3.description: Julis keeps her promise and shows Ayato around the city on their day off. Finally, he gets to know the princess better.

e4.title: Unshackled
e4.description: Julis runs off after reading a letter. Ayato goes after her, worried that she might be in danger.

e5.title: Lightning Blade Speed
e5.description: Since Seidoukan and Allekant agreed to co-develop a new type of Lux, a few representatives from Allekant Academy visit the Seidoukan training room. Julis asks Ayato not to get into any duels before the Phoenix Festa!

e6.title: The True Face of the Girl
e6.description: Julis is still angry at Ayato after he went against her word, and Ayato learns more about the current rank #1 holder, Kirin Toudou.

e7.title: Decisions and Duels
e7.description: After fighting the monsters, what other dangers await Ayato and Kirin?

e8.title: A Holiday for Two, Part 2
e8.description: Saya and Kirin have teamed up for the upcoming Phoenix Festa. By the look of things, they need to spend some more time together. The girls skip practice to socialize more. Surprisingly, there is something Kirin would like Saya to do for her...

e9.title: The Phoenix Festa
e9.description: The Phoenix Festa has finally begun. However, there are some important changes to the regulations this time. Ayato and Julis are determined to give it all they have got!

e10.title: The Tyrant Vampire Princess
e10.description: Here comes a new challenger in the Phoenix Festa! The Tyrant Vampire Princess Irene Urzaiz seems to be unstoppable… and her sole target is Ayato!

e11.title: Power and Its Price
e11.description: Ayato searches for Saya per Kirin's request but runs into Priscilla, the Sister of The Tyrant Vampire Princess. Also, Claudia has a secret.

e12.title: The Gravisheath
e12.description: The final battle, Ayato and Julis versus The Urzaiz Sisters. Who will win?

e1.title: Divine Revelations
e1.description: The Phoenix Festa continues... Ayato and Julis are facing Luo and Song from Jie Long Academy!

e2.title: Corrupt Ruler
e2.description: A young girl named Flora visits Julis. Meanwhile, Ayato tries to get in touch with Dirk Eberwein in the hope of getting some information regarding his sister, Haruka.

e3.title: Breaking the Memory Barrier
e3.description: Ayato and Julis are fighting against Shenyun and Shenhua Li in the quarterfinals. Since the twins are known to only attack their opponents' weak points, what kind of a strategy will Ayato and Julis come up with?

e4.title: Never Back Down
e4.description: Ayato and Julis continue their battle against Shenyun and Shenhua Li. Also, Saya and Kirin are facing AR-D and RM-C. Will Seidoukan Academy live up to the high expectations?

e5.title: The Tyrant's Puppet Strings
e5.description: Flora is abducted by a mysterious man. Now, Ayato and his friends have to come up with a plan to rescue her!

e6.title: Scrambling
e6.description: It's time for the semi-finals, where Ayato and Julis face Galahadworth’s True Knights. Meanwhile, Saya and Kirin search for the missing Flora.

e7.title: Battle Song
e7.description: Ayato is looking around parts of the city, hoping to get a trace about where Flora might be... Unfortunately, his efforts disturb certain people.

e8.title: The Phoenix Showdown
e8.description: Ayato and Julis face off against AR-D and RM-C in the Phoenix Festa finals, but Ayato is still without the Ser Veresta. Meanwhile, Saya and Kirin are trying to rescue Flora from her kidnapper. Can they save her in time?

e9.title: Clinching Victory
e9.description: The final match continues... Which team will win the Phoenix Festa?

e10.title: Liseltania
e10.description: Ayato and his friends visit Lieseltania, where they are greeted with great enthusiasm! Surprisingly, Claudia has an interesting proposal for Ayato, Julis, Saya, and Kirin.

e11.title: The Lonely Strega
e11.description: Julis’s brother, Jolbert, wants to discuss two important topics with Julis and Ayato. While spending time in Lieseltania, Julis runs into a face from her past.

e12.title: Reunion
e12.description: Ayato wakes up three days after fighting Ophelia. Julis explains Ophelia's tragic past. While Gustave unleashes a hydra monster on Julis, Ayato, Julis, and Saya defeat it. Back at Seidoukan, Ayato allows Hilda to operate on Haruka despite knowing her past.

My Deer Friend Nokotan.title: My Deer Friend Nokotan
My Deer Friend Nokotan.description: Koshi Torako has everyone fooled. Her classmates see her as the perfect honor student, unaware of her secret delinquent past. But her new picturesque school life is thrown into chaos when she bumps into Shikanoko Noko, a girl with antlers! Mayhem seems to follow this strange doe-eyed girl. Who, or what, is she?

e1.title: Girl Meets Deer
e1.description: Hiding her past as a former delinquent and living as an honor student, Torako Koshi encounters a mysterious girl with horns hanging from a telephone pole. This mysterious girl, Noko Shikanoko, becomes the source of turmoil that disrupts Torako's life.

e2.title: Deer Meets Darkness Girl
e2.description: Koshitan makes herself comfortable in the room of the Deer Club, but her little paradise is quickly destroyed.

e3.title: Bashame Enrolls
e3.description: Koshitan and Nokotan find a mysterious girl named Bashame collapsed at the entrance of the Deer Club.

e4.title: Deer Club Under Siege
e4.description: The Deer Club is filled with eccentric characters, but the members of the student council give them a run for their money.

e5.title: Dig Up the Dirt!!
e5.description: Koshitan no longer wants to be driven crazy by Nokotan and decides to spy on her to find her weakness. This leads her to the zoo, where she observes Nokotan at work.

e6.title: The Summer Deer Festival
e6.description: It's finally summer in Hino, and that means one thing above all: a new look is in order! The students are wearing their short-sleeved school uniforms, and even Nokotan appears in a new, somewhat concerning state.

e7.title: DeerColle, Streaming, Hospitality, and Such
e7.description: Nokotan wants to participate in the Deer Collection and needs Koshitan's help for it. Koshitan livestreams what daily life is like in the Deer Club. The owner of Café Swallow takes pride in his perfect service, but then Koshitan and Nokotan visit his establishment.

e8.title: Deer After Deer
e8.description: The girls gather for the traditional first shrine visit of the year, but one of them is missing—Nokotan. Soon, the reason for her absence becomes clear, as she is being worshipped at the shrine as the Deer Goddess...

e9.title: Get the Sports Festival Done!
e9.description: Hinominami High School is holding a sports festival! As student council president, Koshitan wants it to go smoothly, but various incidents occur. Will the student council be able to see through to the end of the sports festival?!

e10.title: Blame It on the Spring
e10.description: At the clubhouse, Koshitan finds Nokotan in tears and acting strangely...she's concerned at first, but it turns out to be hay fever. Now, Nokotan's trying to think of ways to cope!

e11.title: The Pursuer and the Pursued
e11.description: Hinominami High School is peaceful as usual. However, Nokotan senses the 'hunter's aura' of Kumatori, a legendary hunter from Hokkaido. Nokotan will take whatever measures necessary to avoid being caught, but what fate awaits her?!

e12.title: Farewell Nokotan!? Long Live the Deer Club!
e12.description: Nokotan has disappeared from everyone's memories!? How is everyone going to handle this sudden serious episode? Koshitan and our viewers are put to the test in the finale, 'Farewell Nokotan!? Long Live the Deer Club!'

Farming Life in Another World.title: Farming Life in Another World
Farming Life in Another World.description: After Hiraku dies of a serious illness, God brings him back to life, gives his health and youth back, and sends him to a fantasy world of his choice. In order to enjoy his second shot, God bestows upon him the almighty farming tool! Watch as Hiraku digs, chops, and ploughs in another world in this laidback farming fantasy!

e1.title: The Almighty Farming Tool
e1.description: Hikaru won’t waste his second chance at life; he will focus on what truly matters. And so, he builds a new home with his own two hands.

e2.title: The First Villager
e2.description: As the weeks turn into months, Hiraku’s loneliness grows. He thought he desired a life of solitude, but his wish for companionship grows stronger by the day.

e3.title: More and More New Roommates
e3.description: Hiraku and Lu begin their new life together, unaware of the visitors who will soon arrive at their household.

e4.title: Waterways Make Life Feel Complete
e4.description: Now that they’ve secured a reliable water source, they can start a rice paddy and build a bathhouse.

e5.title: Curry and Surviving the Winter
e5.description: With their homestead completed, they turn their focus to food preparation and just in time; Winter is coming.

e6.title: This is a Village
e6.description: A surprise attack would have shattered their peaceful lives were it not for the almighty farming tool. As word spreads, their home blooms into a village.

e7.title: A Hospitable Heart
e7.description: Hikaru realizes the importance of diplomacy when the demon lord and the dragons establish contact with the Great Tree Village.

e8.title: The Researcher and The Two Princesses
e8.description: They say civilization started because of alcohol. In the Great Tree Village’s case, it instigates a misunderstanding between dragons.

e9.title: The Merchant and The Dragon
e9.description: Hiraku’s offhand comment leads to a series of events that end with a merchant setting up a trade deal with The Great Tree Village.

e10.title: Princess Yuri
e10.description: Spurred by her followers, the demon lord's daughter attempts to invade the Great Tree Village. "Attempts" being the keyword.

e11.title: Everyday Life, and The Progenitor
e11.description: News of the impending birth thrills the villagers, but they aren’t the only ones interested in the good news.

e12.title: Birth
e12.description: Hiraku’s second chance was just the beginning. As he reflects on the changes that occurred since his arrival, one thing is certain: The Great Tree Village is lively as always.

Danmachi - Sword Oratoria.title: Danmachi - Sword Oratoria
Danmachi - Sword Oratoria.description: After having descended upon this world, the gods have created guilds where adventurers can test their mettle. These guilds, known as 'familia,' grant adventurers the chance to explore, gather, hunt, or simply enjoy themselves. The Sword Princess, Ais Wallenstein, and the novice mage, Lefiya Viridis, are members of the Loki Familia, who are experts at monster hunting. With the rest of their group, they journey to the tower of Babel in hopes of exploring the dungeon underneath. Home to powerful monsters, the dungeon will fulfill Ais's desire to master her sword skills, while bringing Lefiya closer to her dream of succeeding Riveria Ljos Alf, vice-captain of the Loki Familia, as the most powerful mage in the land.

e1.title: The Sword Princess and the Elf
e1.description: Lefiya dreams of fighting in the dungeon beside someone she admires: Ais Wallenstein! When monsters attack the Loki Familia camp, will Lefiya be able to prove her worth?

e2.title: Fittings and Purchases
e2.description: The members of the Loki Familia recover from their most recent adventure. After a long day of errands, they visit Loki's favorite tavern where Ais runs into a familiar face.

e3.title: Festivals and Courage
e3.description: A day at Monsterphilia turns deadly when some of the monsters escape. While Ais tracks them down, a powerful monster attacks Lefiya and the twins.

e4.title: The Murder and the Jewel
e4.description: Ais and the others get tangled in a brutal murder on the 18th floor. Meanwhile, Loki and Bete investigate the strange plant creatures involved in the Monsterphilia incident.

e5.title: The Red-head and the Lone Ruler
e5.description: Loki attempts to get answers from Lord Uranus. Meanwhile, as the battle rages in the dungeon, Ais finds herself crossing swords with the murderer in a fight to the death.

e6.title: Subjugation and Escape
e6.description: Riveria chaperones Ais as she takes on a brutal boss alone. On their way out, Ais discovers an unconscious, but familiar, white haired boy, and decides to take care of him.

e7.title: Requests and Divisions
e7.description: A mysterious figure sends Ais to investigate the 24th floor where she teams up with the Hermes Familia. Meanwhile, Dionysus sends Filvis with Lefiya and Bete into the dungeon.

e8.title: The Corruption and The Maiden
e8.description: Bete confronts Filvis about her past bloody while Lefiya tries harder to integrate her into their team. Meanwhile, the Hermes Familia tries to reclaim Ais from the Tamer.

e9.title: Training and Jealousy
e9.description: Ais finally gets her chance to speak to Bell, and the two agree to train together. When a brokenhearted Lefiya catches them, she becomes determined to get Ais to notice her!

e10.title: The Boy and the Hero
e10.description: The Loki Familia prepares for its expedition deep into the dungeon. Amid the excitement, Ais prepares for what she may find past Level 59.

e11.title: Adventure and the Unknown
e11.description: The Loki Familia expedition reaches Level 50. Armed with new weapons and determination, they delve in the dungeon's hellish depths. Meanwhile, Revis lies in wait for Ais.

e12.title: Kin of the Gods
e12.description: The Loki Familia run into a formidable foe, even together, will they still be able to defeat the monster?

Classroom of the Elite.title: Classroom of the Elite
Classroom of the Elite.description: Kiyotaka Ayanokoji has just enrolled at Tokyo Koudo Ikusei Senior High School, where it's said that 100% of students go on to college or find employment. But he ends up in Class 1-D, which is full of all the school's problem children. What's more, every month, the school awards students points with a cash value of 100,000 yen, and the classes employ a laissez-faire policy in which talking, sleeping, and even sabotage are permitted during class. One month later, Ayanokoji, Horikita, and the students of Class D learn the truth of the system in place within their school...

e1.title: What is evil? Whatever springs from weakness.
e1.description: Melancholy, unmotivated Kiyotaka Ayanokouji attends his first day at Tokyo Metropolitan Advanced Nurturing High School, a government-established institution for training Japan's best and brightest. As he navigates the school's merit-based system, he forms curious relationships with fellow outsiders Suzune Horikita and Kikyou Kushida.

e2.title: It takes a great talent and skill to conceal one's talent and skill.
e2.description: Class 1-D learns more about the school's point system and faces potential expulsion if they don't change their habits. However, some students resist change despite the consequences.

e3.title: Man is an animal that makes bargains: no other animal does this - no dog exchanges bones with another.
e3.description: Kiyotaka explains to Suzune what he did before the test that resulted in high scores for everyone except Sudo, who faces expulsion.

e4.title: We should not be upset that others hide the truth from us, when we hide it so often from ourselves.
e4.description: Class 1-D analyzes their test results and deals with delayed point distributions. Three students from 1-C report Sudo for attacking them.

e5.title: Hell is other people.
e5.description: Kiyotaka and Kushida accompany Sakura to the mall where she repairs her camera. Kiyotaka discusses Sudo's situation with Sakura and whether she should reveal what she saw.

e6.title: There are two kinds of lies; one concerns an accomplished fact, the other concerns a future duty.
e6.description: Sakura receives strange messages and photos of herself on her portal. Kiyotaka and Suzune search for evidence to exonerate Sudo.

e7.title: Nothing is as dangerous as an ignorant friend; a wise enemy is to be preferred.
e7.description: During summer vacation, Suzune prefers studying alone in her room. Ayanokouji invites her to the pool with others.

e8.title: Abandon all hope, ye who enter here.
e8.description: All students go on a cruise. Chabashira informs Kiyotaka that someone has requested his expulsion unless he helps others promote to Class A.

e9.title: Man is condemned to be free.
e9.description: As part of a special test, students are taken to an uninhabited tropical island where they must live for a week. Their performance will significantly impact their class standings.

e10.title: Every man has in himself the most dangerous traitor of all.
e10.description: Class D shows unity in facing the special test. Ayanokouji and Horikita investigate how other classes are faring.

e11.title: What people commonly call fate is mostly their own stupidity.
e11.description: Class D's trust erodes after a panty thief incident. Horikita's leader key card is stolen, leading to chaos in the base camp with a new arson incident.

e12.title: Genius lives only one story above madness.
e12.description: As the survival test concludes, Class 1-D faces challenges with stolen key cards and Suzune's forced withdrawal due to illness. Ayanokouji seeks to turn things around.

e1.title: Remember to keep a clear head in difficult times.
e1.description: Following the island test, Ayanokoji Kiyotaka and others enjoy summer vacation on a luxury liner. Suddenly, they face a new special test, breaking class lines.

e2.title: There are two main human sins from which all the others derive: impatience and indolence.
e2.description: After Day 1 of the 'thinking' test, Ayanokoji discusses breaking the stalemate with Hirata. Meanwhile, he notices strange behavior from Karuizawa and seeks Horikita's insights.

e3.title: The greatest souls are capable of the greatest vices as well as of the greatest virtues.
e3.description: Karuizawa faces intense pressure from Class C. Ayanokoji observes but gets an idea after noticing her abnormal fear levels.

e4.title: The material has to be created.
e4.description: Preparations for the sports festival begin with nervousness among students. The festival's outcome will affect their written tests.

e5.title: Every failure is a step to success.
e5.description: Ayanokoji suspects Kushida of betrayal and observes other classes with Horikita during the festival. He remains disinterested in the outcomes.

e6.title: Adversity is the first path to truth.
e6.description: As the sports festival concludes, Horikita faces challenges from Sudo and Ryuen's threats.

e7.title: To doubt everything or to believe everything are two equally convenient solutions; both dispense with the necessity of reflection.
e7.description: Class D prepares for the 'Paper Shuffle' test where failure means expulsion.

e8.title: The wound is at her heart.
e8.description: Horikita uses the Paper Shuffle to settle matters with Kushida, drawing Ayanokoji into the conflict.

e9.title: If you make a mistake and do not correct it, this is called a mistake.
e9.description: As the Paper Shuffle approaches, conflicting plans converge.

e10.title: People, often deceived by an illusive good, desire their own ruin.
e10.description: Ayanokoji learns more about his situation from an external visitor.

e11.title: A man who cannot command himself will always be a slave.
e11.description: Karuizawa faces embarrassment over the loss of contact with Ayanokoji. Class D plans its future while dealing with Class C's dominance.

e12.title: Force without wisdom falls of its own weight.
e12.description: Ayanokoji makes a final decision on how to confront Ryuen and Class C.

e13.title: The worst enemy you can meet will always be yourself.
e13.description: The aftermath of the gymnasium incident unfolds as Christmas brings romance to the school.

e1.title: The strongest principle of growth lies in the human choice.
e1.description: Class C embarks on their first trial as the ascended class, facing challenges during the mixed training camp.

e2.title: Man is wolf to man.
e2.description: Yukimura injures his leg during training. Later, he devises a strategy for the upcoming tests amidst challenges.

e3.title: Man never forgets what he wants to forget.
e3.description: Class C discusses Karuizawa and Hirata's breakup. Yamauchi encounters a trap set by Sakayanagi, while rumors swirl around Ichinose.

e4.title: To work you have the right, but not to the fruits thereof.
e4.description: Valentine's Day brings anticipation among Class C boys about receiving chocolates. Karuizawa feels uneasy about Ayanokoji's meeting request.

e5.title: Fortune favors the bold.
e5.description: Hashimoto is revealed as the rumor spreader under Sakayanagi's direction. Sakayanagi presents evidence regarding Ichinose's rumors to Class C.

e6.title: It is better to receive an injury than to inflict one.
e6.description: Class C passes their year-end exam with relief, but faces a special exam involving a class vote for praise and censure.

e7.title: People will do anything, no matter how absurd, in order to avoid facing their own souls
e7.description: Suspicion and tension fill Class C as they prepare for the class vote. Asahina informs Ayanokoji about Ichinose seeking cooperation from the student council.

e8.title: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
e8.description: After consulting with her brother, Horikita nominates Yamauchi for expulsion due to his minimal contributions and involvement with Sakayanagi.

e9.title: Extreme justice is extreme injustice.
e9.description: Class C expels its first student through the class vote. Ayanokoji confronts Sakayanagi, leading to a challenge for their next exam.

e10.title: The first cause of absurd conclusions I ascribe to the want of method.
e10.description: Class C discusses strategies for a special exam lacking a decisive factor. Hirata remains disappointed by the class vote outcome.

e11.title: There is only one rule in love: bring happiness to those you love.
e11.description: As Hirata recovers, Class C shows unity. Ayanokoji faces off against Sakayanagi in the final special exam, starting with basketball.

e12.title: Change your desires rather than the order of the world.
e12.description: Despite a close fight, Class C loses to Class A in the final exam and is demoted back to Class D. The students reflect on their growth throughout the year.

e13.title: Love is the best teacher.
e13.description: Spring break arrives. Shiina discusses books with Ayanokoji, while Kanzaki from Class B confronts Ryuen despite their class's defeat.

By the Grace of the Gods.title: By the Grace of the Gods
By the Grace of the Gods.description: Only 39 years into a life full of bad luck, Ryoma Takebayashi passes away in his sleep! Taking pity on him, three divine beings show compassion by reincarnating him as a young boy to a magical, new world. Now he spends his time researching and caring for slimes in the forest. But after healing an injured traveler, Ryoma decides to set out with his new friends on a journey to use his power to help others. A whole new world awaits him, where his skills as a magic user and slime tamer continue to elicit surprise and admiration.

e1.title: Ryoma, with the Slimes
e1.description: Ryoma Takebayashi, formerly a middle-aged Japanese office worker in his previous life, saves a group of distressed travelers in the forest.

e2.title: Departure, with the Slimes
e2.description: The travelers Ryoma saved turn out to be the local duke and his family. Impressed by Ryoma's skills, they invite him to join their journey.

e3.title: First Time in Town, with the Slimes
e3.description: Ryoma and the Jamil family travel to Gimul, a mining town. Ryoma and Eliaria begin their paths as professionals in their crafts.

e4.title: Clean-Up Duty, with the Slimes
e4.description: Ryoma demonstrates his slimes' remarkable cleaning abilities in Gimul, addressing the town's urgent need for sanitation.

e5.title: The Lady's Training Session, with the Slimes
e5.description: Eliaria and Ryoma train in magic and combat in Gimul, preparing to combat monsters infesting abandoned mine shafts.

e6.title: Monster Hunting, with the Slimes
e6.description: Ryoma joins a large-scale monster hunting effort organized by the Adventurer's Guild to tackle a major monster infestation.

e7.title: Starting the Business, with the Slimes
e7.description: Ryoma decides to become an adventurer and entrepreneur. He lays out his plans with the ducal family and collaborates with Serge the merchant.

e8.title: Laundry Business, with the Slimes
e8.description: Ryoma's laundry business opens successfully. He hires new employees and celebrates with friends who have supported him.

e9.title: The New Coworkers, with the Slimes
e9.description: The laundry business gains popularity, prompting Ryoma to hire more help. He meets Fei and Li Ling, foreigners with a mysterious past.

e10.title: The New Slimes, with the Slimes
e10.description: With his business thriving, Ryoma can focus on studying his slimes and adventuring. He discovers new types of slimes.

e11.title: Taming Training, with the Slimes
e11.description: Ryoma and Eliaria receive training in monster taming magic from the Jamil elders, further developing their skills.

e12.title: The Beginning of a New Era, with the Slimes
e12.description: Ryoma and Eliaria attempt to tame limour birds, marking a milestone in their monster taming careers. However, Eliaria's departure for school looms.

e1.title: Ryoma and the New Plan
e1.description: Ryoma decides to reinforce glass in his shop after an incident. He discovers the evolved form of a Poison Slime and meets Tekun, a new god.

e2.title: Ryoma and the Crime Prevention Drill
e2.description: Ryoma faces threats against his shop and decides to spread positive rumors. He also plans to open a second shop in another city.

e3.title: Ryoma and the Poster Girl
e3.description: In Lenaf, Ryoma meets Pioro and Miyabi while setting up his second shop. He takes on a quest involving a Smash Boar for the Adventurers Guild.

e4.title: Ryoma and the Second Shop
e4.description: After dealing with a Smash Boar, Ryoma opens his second shop with help from new hires. He plans to explore the Magical Item Market.

e5.title: Ryoma and the New Acquaintance
e5.description: Ryoma takes on adventurer quests and gains a new acquaintance during a delivery quest to Keleban.

e6.title: Ryoma and the Magic Item Market
e6.description: At the Magical Item Market, Ryoma meets Fedele and develops new products with his slimes. He also meets G-Ranked adventurers.

e7.title: Ryoma and the Local Cuisine
e7.description: Ryoma decides to run a food stall at an upcoming festival after learning about it from Eliaria.

e8.title: Ryoma and the Traveling Entertainer
e8.description: Ryoma hunts Tunnel Ants and hires Beck and his adventuring group. He also meets Prenance, the leader of the Semroid Troupe.

e9.title: Eliaria and the New Friends
e9.description: Eliaria starts her magical academy life and makes new friends. They go on a camping trip and demonstrate their skills.

e10.title: Ryoma and the Flying Slime
e10.description: Ryoma accepts a quest with his adventurer friends to harvest Treant materials and faces an Elder Treant.

e11.title: Ryoma and Busy Days
e11.description: Preparing for the Founders Festival keeps Ryoma busy after completing a quest.

e12.title: Ryoma and the Town of Gimul
e12.description: Ryoma participates in the Founders Festival and helps a lost boy. He ends the festival with a performance by the Semiroid Troupe.

Oshi No Ko.title: Oshi No Ko
Oshi No Ko.description: Dr. Goro is reborn as the son of the young starlet Ai Hoshino after her delusional stalker murders him. Now, he wants to help his new mother rise to the top, but what can a child do about the dark underbelly of the entertainment industry?

e1.title: Mother and Children
e1.description: Ai's story explores the world of entertainment where stories are lies meant to entertain, yet also hold truth.

e2.title: Third Option
e2.description: Ruby pursues her dream of becoming an idol for herself and a deceased child. Aqua faces the harsh reality of the entertainment industry.

e3.title: Manga-Based TV Drama
e3.description: Aqua investigates a connection between Masaya Kaburagi and Ai on the set of a TV drama based on a manga.

e4.title: Actors
e4.description: Kana's determination remains strong despite challenges, with Aqua making bold moves to support her.

e5.title: Reality Dating Show
e5.description: Aqua, Ruby, and Kana navigate different paths in the entertainment industry, striving for success.

e6.title: Egosurfing
e6.description: Consequences unfold for past online actions, affecting the lives of those involved.

e7.title: Buzz
e7.description: Akane's friends rally to clear her name in the aftermath of a scandal.

e8.title: First Time
e8.description: Aqua's focus on revenge leads to unexpected outcomes, while Kana navigates her feelings.

e9.title: B Komachi
e9.description: MEM-cho supports B Komachi's growth while Aqua uncovers more about Ai's past.

e10.title: Pressure
e10.description: As B Komachi prepares for their debut performance, tensions rise within the group.

e11.title: Idol
e11.description: In the season finale, characters face defining moments as they pursue their aspirations in the competitive world of idols.

Danmachi.title: Danmachi
Danmachi.description: In a world, where the deities have descended from the heavens lies the town of Orario that features the Dungeon, which contains an assortment of monsters from goblins to dragons. Adventurers slay those monsters and take their shards, which are then used to craft magic items. To become an adventurer, people join groups called Familia. Each of which is named after and serves a resident deity. The adventurers and their attributes and abilities are ranked by level, improved by experience and supervised by their Familia's deity. Bell Cranel, a novice adventurer, is the sole member of the Familia under the goddess Hestia. After being saved by top level adventurer Ais Wallenstein of the Loki Familia, he falls in love with her and decides to improve and become worthy of her attention. All the while mostly unaware that other girls, deities and mortals, also develop feelings for him. Especially Hestia herself.

e1.title: (Bell Cranel) Adventurer
e1.description: In the Labyrinth city of Orario, a new adventurer, Bell Cranel, faces the perilous dungeon not for treasure but in hopes of winning a girl's heart.

e2.title: (Monsterphilia) Monster Festival
e2.description: Bell's power surges due to his ability, Realis Phrase, fueled by love. Hestia, jealous of his affection for another girl, seeks to support him with a powerful sword.

e3.title: (Hestia Knife) The Blade of a God
e3.description: During the Monster Philia festival, Bell and Hestia face danger from an escaped monster, forcing Bell to protect his only family.

e4.title: (Supporter) The Weak
e4.description: Bell meets Lilika, a supporter who helps adventurers in the dungeon, as he advances to the 7th floor.

e5.title: (Grimoire) Magic Book
e5.description: With Lili's assistance, Bell progresses deeper into the dungeon, but Lili harbors a secret desire to deceive him.

e6.title: (Liliruca Arde) Reason
e6.description: Lili betrays Bell, leaving him surrounded by monsters while she escapes with his knife.

e7.title: (Aiz Wallenstein) Sword Princess
e7.description: Bell convinces Hestia to include Lili in their party, while he seeks help from Aiz Wallenstein, the girl he loves.

e8.title: (Argonaut) Wanting To Be A Hero
e8.description: Bell faces a powerful minotaur while trying to rescue Lili, but Aiz arrives just in time to aid him.

e9.title: (Welf Crozzo) Blacksmith
e9.description: After defeating the minotaur, Bell earns the title 'Little Rookie' but learns he needs a larger party to succeed.

e10.title: (Pass Parade) Procession of Monsters
e10.description: Bell and his party are ambushed by a massive train of monsters, leading to a desperate situation underground.

e11.title: (Under Resort) Labyrinth Utopia
e11.description: Having reached the 18th floor, Bell and his party encounter the Loki Familia and take a moment to recover.

e12.title: (Show) Evil Intentions
e12.description: A formidable floor boss attacks, leaving Bell and his friends to confront it without Aiz's help.

e13.title: (Familia Myth) The Story of a Familia
e13.description: In the season finale, Bell must defeat a powerful boss to escape the dungeon, facing the ultimate test of his skills.

e1.title: (Party) Banquet of the Gods
e1.description: Bell embarks on a new adventure as the powerful leader of the Apollo Familia takes notice of him, threatening his life with Hestia.

e2.title: (Apollo) Sun God
e2.description: The Apollo Familia issues a challenge, but Hestia stands firm in her refusal, leading Apollo to try and force her hand.

e3.title: (Conversion) Gathering
e3.description: While Bell trains for the War Game, the rest of the party must rescue Lili, who refuses to leave the Soma Familia despite Hestia's plans.

e4.title: (War Game) War Game
e4.description: The War Games begin, and the Hestia Family prepares to face the entire Apollo Familia to save Bell from Apollo's clutches.

e5.title: (Home) The Hearthfire Mansion
e5.description: After their victory against Apollo, the Hestia Familia wins a mansion and a large sum of money, but Hestia forgets an important detail while recruiting.

e6.title: (Ishtar Familia) City of Lust
e6.description: Bell's new adventure leads him to the pleasure quarters of Orario, uncovering the city's seedy underbelly.

e7.title: (Renard) Fox Person
e7.description: With Haruhime the Renard's help, Bell escapes from the Amazoness prostitutes but contemplates Haruhime's tragic situation.

e8.title: (Ephemeral Dreams) Killing Stone
e8.description: Determined to rescue Haruhime, Bell ventures into the dungeon to gather money but falls into a trap set by the Ishtar Familia.

e9.title: (Barbera) War Prostitutes
e9.description: As the true purpose of the ritual and killing stone are revealed, Bell resolves to take any risk necessary to save Haruhime.

e10.title: (Argonaut) Longing to Be a Hero
e10.description: Freya's raid on the Ishtar Familia disrupts their plans, intensifying the chaos surrounding Bell.

e11.title: (Rakia) Army's Advance
e11.description: With Haruhime safe, tensions rise when Hestia makes a move on Bell, leading to her kidnapping after he shuts her down.

e12.title: (Song of Love) Goddess and Child
e12.description: Bell and Hestia enjoy a peaceful few days at a village festival, where Bell reflects on his feelings for his immortal Goddess.

e1.title: (Wiene) A Dragon Girl
e1.description: Monsters are deemed evil abominations, but Wiene, a scared little girl, questions why she's being hunted.

e2.title: (Monster) A Single Wing
e2.description: The Hestia Familia seeks answers about Wiene’s existence, but their discoveries in the dungeon raise more questions.

e3.title: (Xenos) Heretics
e3.description: The Guild is aware of Wiene, yet assigns the Hestia Familia a mission they cannot refuse, with dark secrets awaiting in the dungeon.

e4.title: (Yearning) A Far-Off-Dream
e4.description: Wiene discovers others like her, called Xenos. Uranus requests much from the Hestia Familia, believing they can bridge the gap between species.

e5.title: (Ikelos Familia) The King of Calamity
e5.description: A new era dawns, but selfish men prioritize their desires, leaving dire consequences for others.

e6.title: (Knossos) A Man-Made Labyrinth
e6.description: Despite warnings, Bell chooses to get involved, inadvertently helping Fels uncover a secret even Uranus doesn’t know.

e7.title: (Dix Perdix) A Dream of Beasts
e7.description: The lengths a fanatic will go to prove his beliefs correct are boundless.

e8.title: (Bell Cranel) The Fool
e8.description: The seasoned Loki Familia faces an unusual opponent in this battle.

e9.title: (Stigma) Downfall
e9.description: With Ikelos scapegoated, public opinion turns against Bell, complicating aid for the Xenos—unless Hermes’ intel changes the situation.

e10.title: (Invisible) Forced Breakthrough
e10.description: The Hestia Familia must smuggle the Xenos back into the Dungeon as the Loki Familia stands in their way.

e11.title: (Ultra Soul) Decisive Battle
e11.description: Bell is determined to stay true to his ideals, even if it means opposing the woman he loves.

e12.title: (Argonaut) Return of the Hero
e12.description: As Hermes reveals his true intentions, Bell faces his most powerful opponent yet in an epic battle.

e1.title: Prelude | Night Before Departure
e1.description: Gather your party and venture forth, Bell. The dungeon awaits.

e2.title: The Great Falls | The Great Falls
e2.description: Bell and his party are making good time but Cassandra can't shake her ominous premonition.

e3.title: Parasite | Viscum Album
e3.description: With two dire options, the party must choose between retreating or hunting the monster.

e4.title: Mermaid | The Girl of Water City
e4.description: The party learns too late that the Moss Huge can use other monsters against them.

e5.title: Argo Vesta | Heroic Slash of Holy Flame
e5.description: Haruhime's new ability changes the battle's tide, but Lili faces a tough strategic choice.

e6.title: Rabbit's Foot | Rabbit's Foot
e6.description: Bell's fame brings change, while Ryu mysteriously vanishes after leaving a note.

e7.title: Cassandra Ilion | Dream Seer
e7.description: With Ryu accused of murder, only Cassandra knows the tragedy that awaits them.

e8.title: Mirabilis | Chaos
e8.description: As the body count rises, Bell questions how well he really knows Ryu.

e9.title: Lambton | Ill Omen
e9.description: Bell and Ryu confront Jura while the rest of the party uncovers a dark secret.

e10.title: Juggernaut | The Destroyer
e10.description: Some monsters must be fought, others fled from—beware the Juggernaut.

e11.title: Endless | Brutal
e11.description: The Juggernaut wreaks havoc, forcing Ryu to confront her past in this mid-season finale.

e1.title: Amphisbaena | A Song of Despair
e1.description: With retreat an impossibility, Bell’s party fight for their lives when a Floor Boss spawns early. However, they are all adventurers; they will not die so easily.

e2.title: Morgue | Victim
e2.description: Critically wounded and trapped within the dungeon’s darkened depths, Bell and Ryu’s adventure is over. Their fight for survival has now begun.

e3.title: Daphne Lauros | Friend
e3.description: The boss fight extracts a heavy toll on the party, and they must make a choice. If they go one way, they will live. But if they go the other? They will die.

e4.title: Ignis | Flame
e4.description: The party narrowly survived, and now they must search for their missing friends. However, they’re facing more than just monsters; they’re fighting the Dungeon itself.

e5.title: Welf Crozzo | Shikou
e5.description: Bell and Ryu must cast reservations aside in the face of death. Meanwhile, Welf faces a trial by fire he cannot fail; lives are at stake.

e6.title: White Palace | White Labyrinth
e6.description: Bell and Ryu’s relationship deepens as the trauma of the Deep Floors pushes them past their limits. They have each other, and that is the only reason they’re both still alive.

e7.title: Desperate | Dungeon Do-or-Die Time
e7.description: Hope glimmers in the darkness; the Xenos appear in the party’s hour of need, and Bell and Ryu make steady progress despite all odds.

e8.title: Colosseum | Combat Arena
e8.description: Their luck couldn’t last forever; Bell and Ryu must cross the Colosseum, where monsters constantly respawn. In the end, they may face an impossible choice…

e9.title: Astrea Familia | Heroic Death
e9.description: It is too late for the Astrea Familia. Their story ends in tragedy, and this is the tale of how Ryu's life changed forever on that dark day.

e10.title: Daydream | A Sweet Lie
e10.description: Ryu’s feelings for Bell have changed in a way she cannot quite place. All she knows is that she cannot lose him; she just cannot.

e11.title: Luvia | Starry Flower
e11.description: After five years of grief, guilt, and pain, Ryu finally faces a new path—a new justice. The Juggernaut should beware.

In Another World with My Smartphone.title: In Another World with My Smartphone
In Another World with My Smartphone.description: Touya Mochizuki was accidentally killed, and as an apology, God allows him to be reborn in a fantasy world and will grant him any one wish he desires. And so, Touya chooses to keep his smartphone in the next world. In his second chance at life, he befriends many important figures and comes across the world's secret. He inherits the legacy of an ancient civilization and travels around nonchalantly while possessing powers that rival this world's kings.

e1.title: Awakening, and Another World
e1.description: After dying due to God's mistake, Touya is reborn in another world?! There he meets the twin sisters, Elze and Linze, and starts his new life in another world along with the smartphone he got God to let him use in the new world.

e2.title: First Journey, and Samurai
e2.description: While surprised by the differences from his previous world, Touya is growing accustomed to living in the new world with his smartphone. Together, he, Elze, and Linze accept a mission to head to the Royal Capital.

e3.title: Shougi Board, and Underground Ruins
e3.description: Touya and the others head to ruins on a new quest from the Guild to defeat a dullahan. There they encounter the ancient royal capital, abandoned after the capital was moved a millennium ago.

e4.title: Engagement, and an Uninvited Visitor
e4.description: Touya is brought to the royal palace by the Duke. There he finds the King, bedridden, on the verge of death after being poisoned by someone...

e5.title: Slime Castle, and New Functions
e5.description: Touya and the others set out to investigate some magic beasts, but it turns out their destination is the castle of a mage who researched slimes, which they'd all been avoiding (though Touya seems excited?).

e6.title: Moving, and a Dragon
e6.description: After receiving a huge mansion in place of court rank, Touya and the others begin living their usual dense, thickheaded lifestyle. Then they receive a mission to head all the way to Mismede because she'd like to use Touya's Gate spell for talks with The Kingdom of Mismede.

e7.title: Nation of Beastmen, and an Observer
e7.description: Touya's party heads out for Mismede once more. Then they finally arrive in Mismede's royal capital, Berge. Their party heads to the palace and gains audience with King Jamukha. Then somehow Touya and the King end up doing battle in their fighting arena?!

e8.title: Daily Life, and Onward to Eashen
e8.description: After returning from the Kingdom of Mismede, Touya and the others enjoy their daily life. Yet behind the scenes the women battle over the bicycle Touya created! At Sushie's request they head to Mismede and return to find Leen and Paula.

e9.title: Oedo, and the Immortal Gem
e9.description: Touya arrives in Oedo, a Japanese-style castle town within Tokugawa Ieyahsu's domain, and quickly heads to Yae's home. There he meets their servant, Ayane, and Yae's mother, Nanae, before hearing that Yae's father and brother went off to war with Ieyahsu.

e10.title: Ocean, and Vacations
e10.description: After arriving at the beach where the Nilya Ruins lie, Touya and the others take a moment to enjoy the seaside. With so many beautiful girls in swimsuits, Touya's heart is racing!

e11.title: Panties, and an Aerial Garden
e11.description: Before him lies a young girl in white panties. After Touya arrives at the aerial garden, he's greeted by a young girl in white panties, Francesca. She's the keeper of the garden.

e12.title: Decisions, and With My Smartphone
e12.description: When Touya returns to the mansion, the problem of taking his brides awaits. Yumina and Linze (mostly Yumina) push and push until Touya accepts his engagements. Even Elze and Yae get to join in the polygyny! Hey, are you okay with this, protagonist?!

e1.title: Engagement Rings and a Hot Spring
e1.description: Touya is now engaged to Yumina, Elze, Linze, and Yae, and he's enjoying his second life in another world as the five of them complete an extermination quest for mythril golems in order to raise their adventurer rank.

e2.title: Deserted Survivors and the Workshop
e2.description: Leen notifies Touya that's she's discovered another ruin of Babylon, so they head to the Rabbi Desert in the Burning Kingdom of Sandora. Along the way, they discover a group of stranded people under attack by crystalline monsters known as the Phrase.

e3.title: Collecting Books and a Library Café
e3.description: Touya establishes the library café, Moon Reader, partly to give those who were stranded a place to work. Then he uses the profits from mass producing bicycles at the Workshop to buy up lots of books.

e4.title: Upheaval in the Castle and an Imperial Princess
e4.description: Touya visits the capital city of the Regulus Empire to stock some books for the library café, Moon Reader, only to witness the town engulfed in the flames of war.

e5.title: The Fifth Wife And A Newly Founded Nation
e5.description: Lucia finds herself attracted to Touya after he resolved the coup d'etat at the Regulus Empire. Picking up on that, Yumina proposes that they welcome Lucia in as Touya's fifth fiancée.

e6.title: The Alchemy Ward and an Unexpected Reunion
e6.description: Touya discovers a new ruin of Babylon, the Alchemy Ward of Babylon. He goes through the administrator's compatibility check and becomes the Master of Flora.

e7.title: The Hangar and Frame Gears
e7.description: Touya and the others pay a visit to a deserted island in search of more ruins of Babylon and, thanks to the efforts of his ever-reliable fiancées, they finally discover the Hangar.

e8.title: Two Princes and the Small Fiancée
e8.description: Cloud, the Second Prince of the Kingdom of Linhea visits as the envoy for Sue's marriage proposal. While there, he begs Touya to use his teleportation magic to save his mother who is being held captive by Prime Minister Wardack.

e9.title: Day-Off Dates and the Female Knight
e9.description: Yumina proposes that all six of them go on dates to cultivate their love.

e10.title: Amnesia and the Mystic Eye of Petrification
e10.description: Touya rescues a girl in the forest, and while the technology of the Alchemy Ward is able to completely heal her, her memories remain lost and she's unable to remember her own name and how she got so injured. At her request, Touya names her Sakura.

e11.title: Sister From Another World and a Sparkling First Love
e11.description: The goddess of love pays a visit to Brunhild, calling herself Touya's older sister, Mochizuki Karen. Apparently, she came there to refresh (enjoy a vacation) because Touya is so surrounded by love.

e12.title: Birth of a Prince and With My Smartphone
e12.description: The group discovers the Tower and the Rampart of Babylon. Touya also completes the usual registration with their administrators, Noel and Liora. Meanwhile, there's sudden news from the Kingdom of Belfast that Queen Yuel has given birth.

I've Been Killing Slimes for 300 Years a.title: I've Been Killing Slimes for 300 Years and Maxed Out My Level
I've Been Killing Slimes for 300 Years a.description: After dying of overwork in the real world, I’m reincarnated as an immortal witch, and I spend 300 years enjoying a relaxing life. At some point, though, I end up at level 99! All those years spent killing slimes to make the money to pay the bills gave me a ton of experience points. Rumors of the level 99 witch spread, and soon I’m up to my ears in curious adventurers, duelist dragons, and even a monster girl calling me her mom! I’ve never been on an adventure, but I’m the strongest in the world… What’s going to happen to my relaxing life?!
I've Been Killing Slimes for 300 Years a.internetArchiveUrl: https://ia600100.us.archive.org/15/items/ive-been-killing-slimes-for-300-years-and-maxed-out-my-level/I've Been Killing Slimes for 300 Years and Maxed Out My Level/

e1.title: I Maxed Out My Level
e1.description: Aizawa Azusa, a corporate drone who died of exhaustion from overwork in her previous life, is reincarnated in another world, where she decides to live out a slow and uneventful life forever. But then, 300 years later, she discovers that the experience she earned by defeating slimes every day just to keep up her easy lifestyle has brought her to level 99 and made her the strongest in the world. The rumors begin to spread, and soon trouble comes knocking...

e2.title: Along Came the Daughters
e2.description: After becoming the strongest in the world before she even knew it, Azusa entered into a new lifestyle with her first pupil, Laika the dragon, and discovered fun and enjoyment in it that she hadn't known before. But then, one day, a young girl calling Azusa her 'mama' shows up and proclaims that her younger sister wants to kill Azusa. But Azusa has no memory of giving birth to these two girls, or of becoming a mother at all...

e3.title: Along Came an Elf
e3.description: Just as peace is beginning to reign in Azusa's home, a young elf named Halkara shows up pleading for her help. Halkara says that an energy drink she made angered a terrifying high demon, Beelzebub, who is now out to kill her. Azusa would prefer to avoid anything that might ruin her slow life, but she can't just leave the poor girl to die, so she reluctantly agrees to shelter her...

e4.title: We Went to a Dragon's Wedding
e4.description: Laika's older sister Leila is getting married, so Azusa and her friends set off to visit Mount Rokko, the home of the Red Dragons. The mountain is bustling with the many Red Dragons who have gathered for the ceremony. Azusa congratulates Leila and the ceremony carries on in peace... until the Blue Dragons, a tribe with a long-standing grudge against the Red Dragons, attack in full force!

e5.title: A Ghost Appeared
e5.description: Halkara has built a new Nutri-Spirit factory in a nearby town and is now regularly going there from the cottage in the highlands, but she comes home exhausted every evening. It seems rumors have spread saying there's a ghost showing up at the factory, so she's had to do all the work alone since all the locals are scared to go there. Azusa doesn't deal well with ghosts at all, but she can't bear to let Halkara work herself to exhaustion, so she summons Beelzebub to help and heads to the factory late at night.

e6.title: Along Came a Leviathan
e6.description: Azusa receives an invitation from Beelzebub to attend a ceremony in the land of the demons. It seems she earned a favorable reputation with the demons after stopping the conflict between the two Dragon clans in Laika's homeland. Azusa invites the whole family along for this high honor, but there's one problem: Rosalie, the ghost, can't wear a dress. But Rosalie is part of the family, and Azusa wants to help her dress up like the rest of them, so she uses the power of her maxed level to create a magic spell...

e7.title: We Beat Up a Demon King
e7.description: Halkara's knack for inadvertently causing trouble led her to knock out the Demon King Pecora, and now she's locked in a dungeon. As Halkara's execution draws nearer with each passing moment, Azusa rushes to make a potion with her family's help and, with Beelzebub's guidance, takes it to the first-aid room where Pecora is. After tricking the demons guarding the room, Azusa finally reaches Pecora, but then...

e8.title: A Fake Witch of the Highlands Appeared
e8.description: Laika and Flatorte, the newest member of the family, are constantly bickering. Their tribes do have a history of conflict, but it seems the fact that they haven't been eating as much meat lately is contributing to their irritability. Just then, Natalie from the guild arrives and tells them about a quest to get rid of a massive number of longhammer boars, the perfect quest to fill their hungry bellies...

e9.title: My Daughter Turned Into a Slime and Couldn't Change Back
e9.description: Falfa woke up in the form of a slime! Of course, that's not too shocking since she's a slime spirit, but her sister Shalsha laments that this has never happened before and she doesn't know how to change her back. So Azusa sets off with Shalsha and Beelzebub in search of an 'unusual slime' who might know a way to change Falfa back...

e10.title: A Minstrel Came to Town
e10.description: One day, a girl with rabbit ears comes to the village of Flatta. This nameless, unpopular minstrel, who strums her lute fiercely with her bare fingers and sings with a death growl, is known as Schifanoia. When she passes out in the middle of her concert, Azusa is reminded of the sad stories she's heard of young men who moved to Tokyo hoping to make their major debut, but instead turn into job-hopping middle-aged men playing in bands that never make any profit. So she invites Schifanoia to live at the house in the highlands for a while, but when she just keeps making excuses and refuses to see reality, Flatorte loses her patience...

e11.title: I Ate a Mushroom and Turned Into a Child
e11.description: Halkara throws a mushroom-grilling party, or 'shroompa' for short, and accidently includes some poisonous mushrooms that cause anyone who eats them to shrink... and Azusa eats one. This leads to everyone ridiculing her—or rather, fawning over how cute she looks. Even her daughters are in on it! Azusa is determined to change back to normal, so after a tip from Pecora, she heads to the World Tree along with Fatla and Vania to find a pharmacist who deals in every kind of medicine. She expects a dungeon with 108 floors to fight through, but...

e12.title: We Opened a Coffee Shop
e12.description: Festival season has come to the village of Flatta. The festival has been held there for the past 250 years, but as the only person who knows its entire history since it was started, Azusa has distanced herself from it to let the villagers keep their independence. But her family has shown interest in it and seems excited to see it, so she makes up her mind to change the way she interacts with the village tradition... and thus the one-day-only coffee shop, The Witch's House, was born. Will the villagers enjoy this little shop Azusa's family has created?

Parallel World Pharmacy.title: Parallel World Pharmacy
Parallel World Pharmacy.description: A young pharmacologist and researcher in Japan died from overworking, and was reincarnated in a Medieval Parallel Europe. He was reincarnated as a 10-year-old apprentice to a famous Royal Court pharmacist, had attained an inhuman skills of ability to see through disease, material creation, and material destruction. In a society in which dubious medical practice are rampant, price gouging thru the monopoly of the pharmacist guild, and good medicine aren't available to the commoners. He was recognized by the Emperor at that time and opened a Pharmacy at the corner of the town. He will wipe out the fraud that has swept the world, and deliver to the commoners a truly effective medicine that was developed using present day pharmacology. Thus the boy pharmacist will cheat by using his previous knowledge to create innovative medicines while helping the people of the parallel world, a story about living his new life to the fullest this time.

e1.title: A Reincarnated Pharmacologist and a Parallel World
e1.description: World-class pharmacologist Kanji Yakutani awakens to find himself reincarnated in another world as Farma de Médicis. No longer able to pursue the cutting-edge drug research he did on Earth, he must adjust to life in this new world and in his new family.

e2.title: Master and Apprentice
e2.description: Having discovered a variety of new abilities and learned of the poor availability of medicine in this new world, Farma begins testing what he can do with Substance Creation, Substance Elimination, and his Diagnostic Eye. If he can master the use of Divine Arts, as well as his special abilities, perhaps he can help the people of this world the way he longed to do in his previous life.

e3.title: The Chief Royal Pharmaceutist and the Reincarnated Pharmacologist
e3.description: Farma accompanies his father Bruno on his house call to the Empress. He realizes he has the ability to cure her, but he can't do so without drawing attention that would put him in jeopardy.

e4.title: The Empress and an Imperial Charter
e4.description: Farma continues to treat Empress Élisabeth II, which leads to an unexpected reward.

e5.title: Daily Life at Parallel World Pharmacy and Cosmetics
e5.description: Farma's efforts to create a pharmacy for everyone, nobles and commoners alike, aren't achieving the desired results. But with some help and advice from family and friends, Farma might be able to turn things around.

e6.title: Siblings and the Sea
e6.description: The de Médicis family visits Bruno's newly granted territory of Marseirre so Bruno can be briefed on the situation there. The seaside location provides the perfect opportunity for a beach trip. Upon returning from Marseirre, Farma finds that his pharmacy is even busier than before. However, with this higher profile comes unwanted attention.

e7.title: The Boy with No Shadow and the Inquisitors
e7.description: Farma confronts Grand Temple Inquisitor Salomon, and his sudden conflict with the Inquisition takes a surprising turn.

e8.title: Influenza and The Dawn of Pharmacy
e8.description: Demand for Parallel World Pharmacy's products continues to rise, exceeding the store's capacity to handle. Everyone would benefit if other shops sold Farma's new medicines, but the Saint Fleuve Pharmaceutist Guild strictly forbids its members from involvement with Farma's shop or his medicines. Farma searches for a way to expand access to medicine in this environment.

e9.title: The Story of a Certain Wicked Man
e9.description: Things are looking up in the Saint Fleuve Empire, with Farma's initiatives improving the overall health of the populace. However, word arrives of a mysterious new illness that threatens to sweep the nation. Farma rushes to prepare for this frightening scenario.

e10.title: The Black Death
e10.description: With the Saint Fleuve Fair about to begin, Farma fights to keep the Black Death from ravaging the Empire.

e11.title: The Miracle at L'Estacque
e11.description: As Farma works to save the villagers of L'Estacque, the infected cargo and crew from the rogue ship get ever closer to the capital.

e12.title: Those He Couldn't Cure
e12.description: Farma reaches the capital only to find that plague is spreading swiftly through the city. Can he and the people of the capital get the situation under control and defeat this epidemic?

Solo Leveling.title: Solo Leveling
Solo Leveling.description: They say whatever doesn’t kill you makes you stronger, but that’s not the case for the world’s weakest hunter Sung Jinwoo. After being brutally slaughtered by monsters in a high-ranking dungeon, Jinwoo came back with the System, a program only he could see, that’s leveling him up in every way. Now, he’s inspired to discover the secrets behind his powers and the dungeon that spawned them.

e1.title: I'm Used to It
e1.description: Around ten years ago, gates that connected our world to another dimension began to appear, leading to the rise of hunters who would traverse these gates to fight the magic beasts within. Sung Jinwoo, E-Rank hunter, is the weakest of them all.

e2.title: If I Had One More Chance
e2.description: Jinwoo and his party appear to have cleared a low-level dungeon, when a hidden path to an unfamiliar temple is revealed. There they encounter a set of commandments and a group of monsters that cause them absolute despair.

e3.title: It's Like a Game
e3.description: Jinwoo remains behind in the temple dungeon to save his few surviving party members, and with a swing from the god statue's blade, his life comes to an end—or so it seems, before he wakes up in a hospital bed.

e4.title: I've Gotta Get Stronger
e4.description: Having entered the instance dungeon located inside the subway, Jinwoo levels up time and time again by fighting waves of magic beasts. As he gradually makes his way forward, he finds a long stairway leading deeper underground.

e5.title: A Pretty Good Deal
e5.description: Jinwoo joins a party led by Hwang Dongsuk to meet the headcount necessary for a C-Rank dungeon. Joined by another temporary hire, Yoo Jinho, the party defeats beasts without much trouble, but Jinwoo has suspicions about the group's lack of a healer.

e6.title: The Real Hunt Begins
e6.description: While the C-Rank dungeon raid by Jinwoo and the others seems to be progressing well, the moment they step into an area covered in mana stones with a sleeping dungeon boss, things take a wrong turn.

e7.title: Let's See How Far I Can Go
e7.description: As Jinwoo continues his training, he completes a daily quest one day by doing more than the quest requires, and a key that leads to a certain item appears in front of him.
